page.title: 18Customs, Faceby
page.content: {The Annual Midsummer Wake}of the Lyke Wake Club is held in the barn and adjoining outbuildings at Potto Hill Farm, the club's headquarters and home of Bill Cowley, Chief Dirger and his wife Jean, Chief Witch. Dirgers and Witches, those who have completed the Lyke Wake Walk in 24 hours and wear the black-and-silver coffin-shaped badge, gather to celebrate midsummer. The 40-mile walk over the N.York Moors was started by Bill Cowley and some of his friends in 1955. In 1984, 2534 people completed the Walk, 2343 for the first time. The Cleveland Lyke Wake Dirge is probably our oldest dialect verse, its ideas being of Norse origin. It begins: {"This yah neet(night), this yah neet { Ivvery neet an' all, { Fire an' fleet(flame) an' cannle leet { An' Christ tak up thy saul(soul)"}
